This is a lightweight version that doesn't allow enumerating role\n * members except through off-chain means by accessing the contract event logs. Some\n * applications may benefit from on-chain enumerability, for those cases see\n * {AccessControlEnumerable}.\n *\n * Roles are referred to by their `bytes32` identifier. These should be exposed\n * in the external API and be unique. The best way to achieve this is by\n * using `public constant` hash digests:\n *\n * ```\n * bytes32 public constant MY_ROLE = keccak256(\"MY_ROLE\");\n * ```\n *\n * Roles can be used to represent a set of permissions. To restrict access to a\n * function call, use {hasRole}:\n *\n * ```\n * function foo() public {\n *     require(hasRole(MY_ROLE, msg.sender));\n *     ...\n * }\n * ```\n *\n * Roles can be granted and revoked dynamically via the {grantRole} and\n * {revokeRole} functions. Each role has an associated admin role, and only\n * accounts that have a role's admin role can call {grantRole} and {revokeRole}.\n *\n * By default, the admin role for all roles is `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE`, which means\n * that only accounts with this role will be able to grant or revoke other\n * roles. More complex role relationships can be created by using\n * {_setRoleAdmin}.\n *\n * WARNING: The `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is also its own admin: it has permission to\n * grant and revoke this role. Extra precautions should be taken to secure\n * accounts that have been granted it.\n */\nabstract contract AccessControlUpgradeable is Initializable, ContextUpgradeable, IAccessControlUpgradeable, ERC165Upgradeable {\n    function __AccessControl_init() internal onlyInitializing {\n    }\n\n    function __AccessControl_init_unchained() internal onlyInitializing {\n    }\n    struct RoleData {\n        mapping(address => bool) members;\n        bytes32 adminRole;\n    }\n\n    mapping(bytes32 => RoleData) private _roles;\n\n    bytes32 public constant DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE = 0x00;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Modifier that checks that an account has a specific role. Reverts\n     * with a standardized message including the required role.\n     *\n     * The format of the revert reason is given by the following regular expression:\n     *\n     *  /^AccessControl: account (0x[0-9a-f]{40}) is missing role (0x[0-9a-f]{64})$/\n     *\n     * _Available since v4.1._\n     */\n    modifier onlyRole(bytes32 role) {\n        _checkRole(role);\n        _;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IERC165-supportsInterface}.\n     */\n    function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId) public view virtual override returns (bool) {\n        return interfaceId == type(IAccessControlUpgradeable).interfaceId || super.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`.\n     */\n    function hasRole(bytes32 role, address account) public view virtual override returns (bool) {\n        return _roles[role].members[account];\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Revert with a standard message if `_msgSender()` is missing `role`.\n     * Overriding this function changes the behavior of the {onlyRole} modifier.\n     *\n     * Format of the revert message is described in {_checkRole}.\n     *\n     * _Available since v4.6._\n     */\n    function _checkRole(bytes32 role) internal view virtual {\n        _checkRole(role, _msgSender());\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Revert with a standard message if `account` is missing `role`.\n     *\n     * The format of the revert reason is given by the following regular expression:\n     *\n     *  /^AccessControl: account (0x[0-9a-f]{40}) is missing role (0x[0-9a-f]{64})$/\n     */\n    function _checkRole(bytes32 role, address account) internal view virtual {\n        if (!hasRole(role, account)) {\n            revert(\n                string(\n                    abi.encodePacked(\n                        \"AccessControl: account \",\n                        StringsUpgradeable.toHexString(uint160(account), 20),\n                        \" is missing role \",\n                        StringsUpgradeable.toHexString(uint256(role), 32)\n                    )\n                )\n            );\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and\n     * {revokeRole}.\n     *\n     * To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.\n     */\n    function getRoleAdmin(bytes32 role) public view virtual override returns (bytes32) {\n        return _roles[role].adminRole;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Grants `role` to `account`.\n     *\n     * If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted}\n     * event.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.\n     */\n    function grantRole(bytes32 role, address account) public virtual override onlyRole(getRoleAdmin(role)) {\n        _grantRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Revokes `role` from `account`.\n     *\n     * If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.\n     */\n    function revokeRole(bytes32 role, address account) public virtual override onlyRole(getRoleAdmin(role)) {\n        _revokeRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Revokes `role` from the calling account.\n     *\n     * Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's\n     * purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges\n     * if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced).\n     *\n     * If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked}\n     * event.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - the caller must be `account`.\n     */\n    function renounceRole(bytes32 role, address account) public virtual override {\n        require(account == _msgSender(), \"AccessControl: can only renounce roles for self\");\n\n        _revokeRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Grants `role` to `account`.\n     *\n     * If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted}\n     * event. Note that unlike {grantRole}, this function doesn't perform any\n     * checks on the calling account.\n     *\n     * [WARNING]\n     * ====\n     * This function should only be called from the constructor when setting\n     * up the initial roles for the system.\n     *\n     * Using this function in any other way is effectively circumventing the admin\n     * system imposed by {AccessControl}.\n     * ====\n     *\n     * NOTE: This function is deprecated in favor of {_grantRole}.\n     */\n    function _setupRole(bytes32 role, address account) internal virtual {\n        _grantRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Sets `adminRole` as ``role``'s admin role.\n     *\n     * Emits a {RoleAdminChanged} event.\n     */\n    function _setRoleAdmin(bytes32 role, bytes32 adminRole) internal virtual {\n        bytes32 previousAdminRole = getRoleAdmin(role);\n        _roles[role].adminRole = adminRole;\n        emit RoleAdminChanged(role, previousAdminRole, adminRole);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Grants `role` to `account`.\n     *\n     * Internal function without access restriction.\n     */\n    function _grantRole(bytes32 role, address account) internal virtual {\n        if (!hasRole(role, account)) {\n            _roles[role].members[account] = true;\n            emit RoleGranted(role, account, _msgSender());\n        }\n UNLICENSED\r\n\r\n// If you encounter a vulnerability or an issue, please contact <security@kyklos.earth> or visit security.kyklos.earth\r\npragma solidity 0.8.14;\r\n\r\nimport '@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/access/OwnableUpgradeable.sol';\r\nimport '@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC721/ERC721Upgradeable.sol';\r\nimport '@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/security/PausableUpgradeable.sol';\r\nimport '@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/proxy/utils/UUPSUpgradeable.sol';\r\nimport '@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/access/AccessControlUpgradeable.sol';\r\n\r\nimport './interfaces/ICarbonProjects.sol';\r\nimport './storages/CarbonProjectsStorage.sol';\r\nimport './libraries/Modifiers.sol';\r\nimport './libraries/Strings.sol';\r\n\r\n/// @notice The CarbonProjects contract stores carbon project-specific data\r\n/// The data is stored in structs via ERC721 tokens\r\n/// Most contracts in the protocol query the data stored here\r\n/// The attributes in the Project-NFTs are constant over all vintages of the project\r\n/// @dev Each project can have up to n vintages, with data stored in the\r\n/// `CarbonProjectVintages` contract. `vintageTokenId`s are mapped to `projectTokenId`s\r\n/// via `pvToTokenId` in the vintage contract.\r\ncontract CarbonProjects is\r\n    ICarbonProjects,\r\n    CarbonProjectsStorage,\r\n    ERC721Upgradeable,\r\n    OwnableUpgradeable,\r\n    PausableUpgradeable,\r\n    Modifiers,\r\n    AccessControlUpgradeable,\r\n    UUPSUpgradeable\r\n{\r\n    using Strings for string;\r\n\r\n    // ----------------------------------------\r\n    //      Constants\r\n    // ----------------------------------------\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Version-related parameters. VERSION keeps track of production\r\n    /// releases. VERSION_RELEASE_CANDIDATE keeps track of iterations\r\n    /// of a VERSION in our staging environment.\r\n    string public constant VERSION = '1.1.2';\r\n    uint256 public constant VERSION_RELEASE_CANDIDATE = 1;\r\n\r\n    /// @dev All roles related to accessing this contract\r\n    bytes32 public constant MANAGER_ROLE = keccak256('MANAGER_ROLE');\r\n\r\n    // ----------------------------------------\r\n    //      Events\r\n    // ----------------------------------------\r\n\r\n    event ProjectMinted(address receiver, uint256 tokenId);\r\n    event ProjectUpdated(uint256 tokenId);\r\n    event ProjectIdUpdated(uint256 tokenId);\r\n    event BeneficiaryUpdated(\r\n        uint256 indexed tokenId,\r\n        address oldBeneficiary,\r\n        address newBeneficiary\r\n    );\r\n\r\n    /// @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor\r\n    constructor() {\r\n        _disableInitializers();\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    // ----------------------------------------\r\n    //      Upgradable related functions\r\n    // ----------------------------------------\r\n\r\n    function initialize() external virtual initializer {\r\n        __Context_init_unchained();\r\n        __ERC721_init_unchained(\r\n            'Kyklos Protocol: Carbon Projects',\r\n            'KYKLOS-CP'\r\n        );\r\n        __Ownable_init_unchained();\r\n        __Pausable_init_unchained();\r\n        __AccessControl_init_unchained();\r\n        __UUPSUpgradeable_init_unchained();\r\n\r\n        /// @dev granting the deployer==owner the rights to grant other roles\r\n        _grantRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, msg.sender);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    function _authorizeUpgrade(address newImplementation)\r\n        internal\r\n        virtual\r\n        override\r\n        onlyOwner\r\n    {}\r\n\r\n    // ------------------------\r\n    //      Admin functions\r\n    // ------------------------\r\n    /// @dev modifier that only lets the contract's owner and elected managers add/update/remove project data\r\n    modifier onlyManagers() {\r\n        require(\r\n            hasRole(MANAGER_ROLE, msg.sender) || owner() == msg.sender,\r\n            'Caller is not authorized'\r\n        );\r\n        _;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Emergency function to disable contract's core functionality\r\n    /// @dev wraps _pause(), only Admin\r\n    function pause() external virtual onlyBy(contractRegistry, owner()) {\r\n        _pause();\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev unpause the system, wraps _unpause(), only Admin\r\n    function unpause() external virtual onlyBy(contractRegistry, owner()) {\r\n        _unpause();\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    function setKyklosContractRegistry(address _address)\r\n        external\r\n        virtual\r\n        onlyOwner\r\n    {\r\n        contractRegistry = _address;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Adds a new carbon project along with attributes/data\r\n    /// @dev Projects can be added by data-managers\r\n    function addNewProject(\r\n        address to,\r\n        string memory projectId,\r\n        string memory standard,\r\n        string memory methodology,\r\n        string memory region,\r\n        string memory storageMethod,\r\n        string memory method,\r\n        string memory emissionType,\r\n        string memory category,\r\n        string memory uri,\r\n        address beneficiary\r\n    ) external virtual override onlyManagers whenNotPaused returns (uint256) {\r\n        require(!projectId.equals(''), 'ProjectId cannot be empty');\r\n        require(!projectIds[projectId], 'Project already exists');\r\n        projectIds[projectId] = true;\r\n\r\n        uint256 newItemId = projectTokenCounter;\r\n        unchecked {\r\n            ++newItemId;\r\n            ++totalSupply;\r\n        }\r\n        projectTokenCounter = uint128(newItemId);\r\n\r\n        validProjectTokenIds[newItemId] = true;\r\n\r\n        _mint(to, newItemId);\r\n\r\n        projectData[newItemId].projectId = projectId;\r\n        projectData[newItemId].standard = standard;\r\n        projectData[newItemId].methodology = methodology;\r\n        projectData[newItemId].region = region;\r\n        projectData[newItemId].storageMethod = storageMethod;\r\n        projectData[newItemId].method = method;\r\n        projectData[newItemId].emissionType = emissionType;\r\n        projectData[newItemId].category = category;\r\n        projectData[newItemId].uri = uri;\r\n        projectData[newItemId].beneficiary = beneficiary;\r\n\r\n        emit ProjectMinted(to, newItemId);\r\n        pidToTokenId[projectId] = newItemId;\r\n        return newItemId;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Updates and existing carbon project\r\n    /// @dev Projects can be updated by data-managers\r\n    function updateProject(\r\n        uint256 tokenId,\r\n        string memory newStandard,\r\n        string memory newMethodology,\r\n        string memory newRegion,\r\n        string memory newStorageMethod,\r\n        string memory newMethod,\r\n        string memory newEmissionType,\r\n        string memory newCategory,\r\n        string memory newUri,\r\n        address beneficiary\r\n    ) external virtual onlyManagers whenNotPaused {\r\n        require(_exists(tokenId), 'Project not yet minted');\r\n        projectData[tokenId].standard = newStandard;\r\n        projectData[tokenId].methodology = newMethodology;\r\n        projectData[tokenId].region = newRegion;\r\n        projectData[tokenId].storageMethod = newStorageMethod;\r\n        projectData[tokenId].method = newMethod;\r\n        projectData[tokenId].emissionType = newEmissionType;\r\n        projectData[tokenId].category = newCategory;\r\n        projectData[tokenId].uri = newUri;\r\n        projectData[tokenId].beneficiary = beneficiary;\r\n\r\n        emit ProjectUpdated(tokenId);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Projects and their projectId's must be unique, changing them must be handled carefully\r\n    function updateProjectId(uint256 tokenId, string memory newProjectId)\r\n        external\r\n        virtual\r\n        onlyManagers\r\n        whenNotPaused\r\n    {\r\n        require(_exists(tokenId), 'Project not yet minted');\r\n        if (bytes(newProjectId).length != 0) {\r\n            require(\r\n                projectIds[newProjectId] == false,\r\n                'Cant change current projectId to an existing one'\r\n            );\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        string memory oldProjectId = projectData[tokenId].projectId;\r\n        projectIds[oldProjectId] = false;\r\n\r\n        projectData[tokenId].projectId = newProjectId;\r\n        projectIds[newProjectId] = true;\r\n\r\n        emit ProjectIdUpdated(tokenId);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Updates the project beneficiary\r\n    function updateBeneficiary(uint256 tokenId, address beneficiary)\r\n        external\r\n        virtual\r\n        onlyManagers\r\n        whenNotPaused\r\n    {\r\n        require(_exists(tokenId), 'Project not yet minted');\r\n        address oldBeneficiary = projectData[tokenId].beneficiary;\r\n        projectData[tokenId].beneficiary = beneficiary;\r\n        emit BeneficiaryUpdated(tokenId, oldBeneficiary, beneficiary);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Removes a project and corresponding data, sets projectTokenId invalid\r\n    function removeProject(uint256 projectTokenId)\r\n        external\r\n        virtual\r\n        onlyManagers\r\n        whenNotPaused\r\n    {\r\n        delete projectData[projectTokenId];\r\n        /// @dev set projectTokenId to invalid\r\n        totalSupply--;\r\n        validProjectTokenIds[projectTokenId] = false;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Function used by the utility function `checkProjectTokenExists`\r\n    function isValidProjectTokenId(uint256 projectTokenId)\r\n        external\r\n        view\r\n        virtual\r\n        override\r\n        returns (bool)\r\n    {\r\n        return validProjectTokenIds[projectTokenId];\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev retrieve all data from ProjectData struct\r\n    function getProjectDataByTokenId(uint256 tokenId)\r\n        external\r\n        view\r\n        virtual\r\n        override\r\n        returns (ProjectData memory)\r\n    {\r\n        return (projectData[tokenId]);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId)\r\n        public\r\n        view\r\n        virtual\r\n        override(\r\n            AccessControlUpgradeable,\r\n            ERC721Upgradeable,\r\n            IERC165Upgradeable\r\n        )\r\n        returns (bool)\r\n    {\r\n        return\r\n            interfaceId == type(IAccessControlUpgradeable).interfaceId ||\r\n            ERC721Upgradeable.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    function _baseURI() internal view virtual override returns (string memory) {\r\n        return baseURI;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    function setBaseURI(string memory gateway) external virtual onlyOwner {\r\n        baseURI = gateway;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Returns the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for `tokenId` token.\r\n    /// based on the ERC721URIStorage implementation\r\n    function tokenURI(uint256 tokenId)\r\n        public\r\n        view\r\n        virtual\r\n        override\r\n        returns (string memory)\r\n    {\r\n        require(\r\n            _exists(tokenId),\r\n            'ERC721URIStorage: URI query for nonexistent token'\r\n        );\r\n\r\n        string memory uri = projectData[tokenId].uri;\r\n        string memory base = _baseURI();\r\n\r\n        // If there is no base URI, return the token URI.\r\n        if (bytes(base).length == 0) {\r\n            return uri;\r\n        }\r\n        // If both are set, concatenate the baseURI and tokenURI (via abi.encodePacked).\r\n        if (bytes(uri).length > 0) {\r\n            return string(abi.encodePacked(base, uri));\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        return super.tokenURI(tokenId);\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n","keccak256":"0xc00e5b3d289bd5ce9c18db128e08a4e4c7bd101c73ce1907d99a9f6029adcbec","license":"UNLICENSED"},"contracts/interfaces/ICarbonProjects.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-FileCopyrightText: devdoc.details: Each project can have up to n vintages, with data stored in the `CarbonProjectVintages` contract. `vintageTokenId`s are mapped to `projectTokenId`s via `pvToTokenId` in the vintage contract.

addNewProject(address,string,string,stri.details: Projects can be added by data-managers

getProjectDataByTokenId(uint256).details: retrieve all data from ProjectData struct

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

isValidProjectTokenId(uint256).details: Function used by the utility function `checkProjectTokenExists`

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate that the this implementation remains valid after an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

removeProject(uint256).details: Removes a project and corresponding data, sets projectTokenId invalid

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

tokenURI(uint256).details: Returns the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for `tokenId` token. based on the ERC721URIStorage implementation

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unpause().details: unpause the system, wraps _unpause(), only Admin

updateProject(uint256,string,string,stri.details: Projects can be updated by data-managers

updateProjectId(uint256,string).details: Projects and their projectId's must be unique, changing them must be handled carefully

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

MANAGER_ROLE.details: All roles related to accessing this contract

VERSION.details: Version-related parameters. VERSION keeps track of production releases. VERSION_RELEASE_CANDIDATE keeps track of iterations of a VERSION in our staging environment.

addNewProject(address,string,string,stri.notice: Adds a new carbon project along with attributes/data

pause().notice: Emergency function to disable contract's core functionality

userdoc.notice: The CarbonProjects contract stores carbon project-specific data The data is stored in structs via ERC721 tokens Most contracts in the protocol query the data stored here The attributes in the Project-NFTs are constant over all vintages of the project
